page.title: 17Ecology in Newburgh
page.content: This is an open coastal area.It is unpolluted.You can see this because of lichen growing on walls.It can be very windy because it is such an exposed part of the coast.This also means there are few trees.There are many types of wild flowers.Here are the species,Clover,Daisy,Rose Baywillow Herb and Broom. There is a Field Station called Culterty.It is part of the Department of Zoology.It started in 1958.It researches in birds, mammals,fish and small invertebrates.Culterty is well known in the world of science.They try to find what controls the population of animals.They set traps for small animals.When they get them they weigh and mark them.The most common small mammal is the field vole microtus.The rarest is the water shrew of which only 2 have been caught.
